alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 7:59PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Morris, north central Hunterdon, Warren, east central Monroe and northeastern Northampton Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 759 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Delaware Water Gap, or 17 miles west of Newton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hackettstown, Washington, Blairstown, High Bridge, Stanhope, Netcong, Belvidere, Oxford, Hope, Glen Gardner, Hampton, Califon, Delaware Water Gap, Long Valley, Great Meadows-Vienna, Allamuchy-Panther Valley, Succasunna, Succasunna-Kenvil, Columbia and Budd Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern and northwestern New Jersey...and eastern and northeastern Pennsylvania.
